page.title: Mangafox Downloader
page.description: How to download manga from mangafox site.
page.keywords: download manga, download mangafox, manga, mangafox
page.content:
Download mangas of mangafox site.

Downloads: 0.5

Source code at GitHub


How to download manga from mangafox

This program provide two ways to be used, by GUI that allows one download at a time and by command line, which allows create scripts to automatize the process allowing multiple downloads.

Download by GUI

First you need install Shoes. You can download the latest version (7/2017) clicking here or access the list of versions to be able to download for non-windows systems.


After that, you need download the Mangafox Downloader, de latest version is available in this page.

When the download is finished, just open normally. If the system asks what program you want to open it with then just open the program with Shoes).

To start you download, first you need specify the location where it will be downloaded, then type the name of manga and click in the Search manga button. If the manga exist the cover will appear and you may type the volume and chapter what you want download. (see About section in the program for more information of how type manga, volume and chapter names). If the chapter is not within any volume then leave the vol field blank.

The Download button start the download and the Cancel button stop the download.

Download by command line


First you need install Ruby. For windows users click here or here for other systems.

After, you need download and unzip the source code of Mangafox Downloader available here.

To download by command line you need call the main program script (main.rb) with Ruby.

Parameters:

Download: m:[manga_name], v:[vol_name] (optional), c:[chapter_name], p:[destination_path]

Help: h: | Update: u:

Example: ruby main.rb m:tamen_de_gushi c:c001 p:C:/users/hermes/manga


You can also can create batch files to automatize the process and download multiple chapters. To do this, you need to create a file and save it with the .bat extension. The code here.

Above you can see program working and the final result.

page.title: Tileset Converter MV
page.description: A RPG Maker older versions tilesets converter for RPG Maker MV.
page.keywords: rpg maker, rpg maker mv, converting tilesets, tileset converter
page.content:
A RPG Maker older versions tilesets converter for RPG Maker MV, other functionalities include:

  • Align the image on the sides and center;
  • Resize sprites;
  • Save each sprite;
  • Set transparent color;
  • Place each sprite individually;
  • And has a manual editor.

Source code at GitHub

How open

Open tilecon.sln with Visual Studio, need install .NET Framework version 4.6.1 or higher.

Images

Converter


Editor

Videos

Converter

Editor

Versions

Version Implementation Download
05/11 - 1.9 Fixed bug in the editor;
Fixed general bugs;
Resizable interface.		 MediaFire
24/10 - 1.8.2 Added drag and drop tileset system;
Fixed spelling errors;
Improved performance.		 MediaFire
18/08 - 1.8 RM2k Animated Objects conversion option added. MediaFire
28/05 - 1.7 Editor added. MediaFire
08/05 - 1.6 RMXP Autotile conversion option. MediaFire
10/04 - 1.5.2 Interface bug solved. MediaFire
08/04 - 1.5 Improved resize;
Option to set the color transparent.		 None
02/04 - 1.4 Added support for rmvx/ace;
Removed bug when saving each sprite coming from previous update.		 4Shared
31/03 - 1.3 Added support for rm2000/2003. 4Shared
30/03 - 1.2 Improved resize system;
Added support for rm95 and srm97 conversion.		 4Shared
27/03 - 1.1 Added option to center and resize;
Added support for rmxp conversion;
Added system for cutting and saving isolated sprites.		 4Shared

page.title: Update by Webpage
page.description: System update for ruby programs that checks on a page specifies whether updates are available.
page.content:
System update for ruby programs that checks on a page specifies whether updates are available.


Source code at GitHub


Update system for ruby programs that checks on a page specifies whether updates are available.

How use

Put the rb files in the project's folder, preferably in a subfolder

Link the updatewp.rb in your project.

Create a page or document with the text below inside.

updater[index,version,download_url]


index- to differentiate from other projects on the same page (it is recommended that each be on a separate line)
version - version of the project in download_url, for the updater to know if the pc version is equivalent or superior
download_url - download link of updated project (it is recommended that the project be wrapped in .zip)

Now all you need to do is program.

A tiny doc

Hermes::Update::ByWebPage => string id, float version, string url

bool update => string directory (default "")
returns true if the operation has sucesfully and false if not.

bool update_is_avaliable
returns true if an update is available and false if not.

string get_update_link
returns the download link of update file.

page.title: Dev'lusion
page.description: A game focused in teaching programming logics.
page.content:
A game focused in teaching programming logics.

Download Apha (Windows / Linux / Mac OS X / iOS / Android)

Source code at GitHub

Read in portuguese


Created as T.I activity of course completion.

This game is a prototype and will not be finished.

System requirements

PC - Windows7 or higher / .NET Framework 2.0 or higher /Intel HD 2000 higher
Android - Version 4.0 or higher
iOS - Version 8 or higher
Mac - Processor AMD HD 5000 or higher/ iOS X or higher

page.title: Ramu Engine
page.description: A simple game engine written in javascript.
page.content:
A simple game engine written in javascript.

Downloads: 0.5.2

Source code at GitHub

Currently just works well in chrome.

Demos

  • WORK ON PROGRESS - Player Control, Gravity and Spritesheet Animator
  • WORK ON PROGRESS - Simple A.I
  • Collision, Menu and Machine State
  • Game Sprite and Spritesheet Animation
  • Parallax

page.title: Ramu Player Control
page.description: A simple player control. Include basic movimentation, physics and full animation.
page.content:
<Ramu.canvas id="Ramu.canvas" width="512" height="480" style="border:1px solid #000000;"></Ramu.canvas>

			<script type="text/javascript">	
				// Get code from github
				var ramu   = getCode("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/HermesPasser/Ramu/master/Ramu.js");
				var player = getCode("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/HermesPasser/Ramu/master/demos/player-control-test.js");
				
				// Replacing non local images
				player = player.replace("img/potato.png", "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/HermesPasser/Ramu/master/demos/img/potato.png");
				player = player.replace("img/lightning.png", "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/HermesPasser/Ramu/master/demos/lightning.png");
				player = player.replace("img/lum-rip-by-rojimenez.png", "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/HermesPasser/Ramu/master/demos/lum-rip-by-rojimenez.png");
				
				// Put code in a script tag
				var ramuscript = document.createElement("script");
				ramuscript.setAttribute("type", "text/javascript");
				ramuscript.innerHTML = ramu;
				document.body.appendChild(ramuscript);

				var playerscript = document.createElement("script");
				playerscript.setAttribute("type", "text/javascript");
				playerscript.innerHTML = player;
				document.body.appendChild(playerscript);					
			</script>

page.title: Ramu Parallax
page.content:
<Ramu.canvas id="Ramu.canvas" width="500" height="500" style="border:1px solid #000000;"></Ramu.canvas>
			<script type="text/javascript">		
				var ramu   = getCode("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/HermesPasser/Ramu/master/Ramu.js");

				// Put code in a script tag
				var ramuscript = document.createElement("script");
				ramuscript.setAttribute("type", "text/javascript");
				ramuscript.innerHTML = ramu;
				document.body.appendChild(ramuscript);

				var c = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/HermesPasser/Ramu/master/demos/img/clouds.png";
				var m = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/HermesPasser/Ramu/master/demos/img/montains.png";
				
				// Parallax Test by Hermes Passer in 09-15-17 using Ramu 0.3
				class MyGame extends GameObj{
					start(){
						var sky = new Parallax(c, 1, 1, 500, 500, -2);
						var montains = new Parallax(m, 1, 1, 500, 500);
						sky.setDrawPriority(0)
					}
				}
				new MyGame(0,0);
				Ramu.init();	
			</script>

page.title: Ramu Mapping
page.content:
<Ramu.canvas id="Ramu.canvas" width="500" height="500" style="border:1px solid #000000;"></Ramu.canvas>

			<script type="text/javascript">	
				// Get code from github
				var ramu = getCode("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/HermesPasser/Ramu/master/Ramu.js");
				var map = getCode("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/HermesPasser/Ramu/master/demos/mapping-test.js");
				
				// Replacing non local images
				// isso quebra se as imagens não estiverem em outro server
				map = map.replace("img/ground.png", "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/HermesPasser/Ramu/master/demos/img/ground.png");
				map = map.replace("img/flying_ground.png", "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/HermesPasser/Ramu/master/demos/img/flying_ground.png");
				
				// Put code in a script tag
				var ramuscript = document.createElement("script");
				ramuscript.setAttribute("type", "text/javascript");
				ramuscript.innerHTML = ramu;
				document.body.appendChild(ramuscript);

				var mapscript = document.createElement("script");
				mapscript.setAttribute("type", "text/javascript");
				mapscript.innerHTML = map;
				document.body.appendChild(mapscript);					
			</script>

page.title: Ramu Collision, Menu and Machine State: The Potato Attack
page.description: A simple game that use menu and collisions.
page.content:
<Ramu.canvas id="Ramu.canvas" width="500" height="500" style="border:1px solid #000000;"></Ramu.canvas>

			<script type="text/javascript">	
				// Get code from github
				var ramu = getCode("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/HermesPasser/Ramu/master/Ramu.js");
				var coll = getCode("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/HermesPasser/Ramu/master/demos/collision-test-potato-atack.js");
				
				// Replacing non local images
				coll = coll.replace("img/potato.png", "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/HermesPasser/Ramu/master/demos/img/potato.png");
				
				// Put code in a script tag
				var ramuscript = document.createElement("script");
				ramuscript.setAttribute("type", "text/javascript");
				ramuscript.innerHTML = ramu;
				document.body.appendChild(ramuscript);

				var collscript = document.createElement("script");
				collscript.setAttribute("type", "text/javascript");
				collscript.innerHTML = coll;
				document.body.appendChild(collscript);					
			</script>

page.title: Game Sprite and Spritesheet Animation
page.content:
<Ramu.canvas id="Ramu.canvas" width="500" height="500" style="border:1px solid #000000;"></Ramu.canvas>

			<script type="text/javascript">	
				// Get code from github
				var ramu = getCode("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/HermesPasser/Ramu/master/Ramu.js");
				var a = getCode("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/HermesPasser/Ramu/master/demos/animation-test.js");

				// Replacing non local images
				a = a.replace("img/gear.png", "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/HermesPasser/Ramu/master/demos/img/gear.png");
				a = a.replace("img/anim/", "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/HermesPasser/Ramu/master/demos/img/anim/");
				
				// Put code in a script tag
				var ramuscript = document.createElement("script");
				ramuscript.setAttribute("type", "text/javascript");
				ramuscript.innerHTML = ramu;
				document.body.appendChild(ramuscript);

				var ascript = document.createElement("script");
				ascript.setAttribute("type", "text/javascript");
				ascript.innerHTML = a;
				document.body.appendChild(ascript);					
			</script>
